explanation:

Example; You can like English more than Maths, but prefer English to Maths.

The correct option is ''B''. Hence we have

undisciplined means they have not been disciplined at all. Indisciplined means they have not been properly / suffiently disciplined.

explanation:
The adverb ''much more'' qualifies the adjective ''clever'' meaning to a large amount or to a large degree.

The subject of the sentence is the ''the girl'' whom the speaker is comparing to a second party. Much more  shows the intensity of the subject's briallaince to that of the sister.
